title: E tu Brute - Position Paper on Justification of Violent Protests
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Academic position paper analyzing when violence in protests can be justified, using Antifa and Black Panther Party as case studies

thesis.claim: Violence can be justified in various circumstances and is sometimes necessary
thesis.counter_to: The fiction that 'Violence can never be justified'
thesis.context: Response to Berkeley protests against Milo Yiannopoulos

historical_context.virginia_motto: Sic Semper Tyrannis (As Always to Tyrants)
historical_context.reality: Various groups within America have had to use violence to get their message across

antifa_origins.origin: Not America - began in countries with openly fascist movements during Berlin Wall era
antifa_origins.first_action: GDR Labor Day rally against Anti-Fascism - group hijacked rally with banners against neo-fascism
antifa_origins.key_insight: Anti-Fascists were never Anti-Violence, even from inception - they wanted war with Fascists
antifa_origins.long_conflict: Antifa and right-wing skinheads have been fighting since 1980s when right-wing burst onto scene
antifa_origins.split: Metal and punk scene split into left-wingers and right-wingers with excessive violence

antifa_vs_violence_misconception.claim: They are the real fascists because they are violent
antifa_vs_violence_misconception.rebuttal: Anti-Fascists were never Anti-Violence - they literally hijacked Anti-War rally

black_panther_context.full_name: Black Panther Party for Self Defense
black_panther_context.purpose: Protecting Black People in segregated America
black_panther_context.problem: White Police would come in Black neighborhoods and do whatever they wanted
black_panther_context.solution: Organized to Police Black Communities and Police the White Police
black_panther_context.founding: 1962 Merritt College study group including Huey Newton, Bobby Seale
black_panther_context.misinterpretation: America misinterpreted demand for end to police brutality as call for retaliatory violence

marcus_garvey_self_determination.thesis: Self-determination as basic tenant for liberation
marcus_garvey_self_determination.quote: Action, self reliance, the vision of self and the future have been the only means by which the oppressed have seen and realized the light of their own freedom

huey_newton_case.charge: Voluntary Manslaughter in murder of Police Officer
huey_newton_case.outcome: California Supreme Court dropped charges - trial unfair
huey_newton_case.reason: No one allowed Huey to enter statement about being shot in stomach and blacking out

hypocrisy_analysis.observation: Same people who say 'violence can never be justified' justify Police violence
hypocrisy_analysis.example_shapiro_trayvon: Would have turned 21 if he hadn't beaten man's head on pavement before being shot
hypocrisy_analysis.example_shapiro_brown: Autopsy supports he was reaching for gun

contrast.antifa: Never murdered a Republican speaker - broke windows
contrast.police: Actually kill people every day - considered justified

hypocrisy_analysis.challenge: If 'violence is never justified', apply that standard to Police and Bin Laden killing

doxxing_and_targeting.tactic: Take personal information and release to internet for trolls to harass
doxxing_and_targeting.milo_response_to_violence: 1,500 more people with weapons on their way - God, it's so sexually exciting!
doxxing_and_targeting.seattle_shooting: 34-year-old protester shot - shooter was Milo supporter seeking autograph earlier

academic_sources: Lawrence 2017 - The Speech That Turned a Campus Against Itself
Weiss 2015 - Civil Society From the Underground: The Alternative Antifa Network in the GDR
Ebony 2016 - Fifty Years of the Black Panther Party
Lueders 2017 - Shut Up Already: The New Battle Over Campus Free Speech

conclusion.misguided: People claiming Antifa is 'fascist' or that 'violence can never be justified' when people break windows
conclusion.reality: Violence can be justified in various circumstances, sometimes necessary
conclusion.note: This paper is not a call to violence but a statement that societal problems allow violence to be justified

quiz_questions.a: GDR/Germany during Berlin Wall era - not America
quiz_questions.explanation: Anti-Fascists hijacked Anti-War rally - were never Anti-Violence from inception

quiz_questions.q: What was the original purpose of the Black Panther Party?
quiz_questions.a: Self Defense - Policing Black Communities and Policing White Police
quiz_questions.explanation: Response to White Police doing whatever they wanted in Black neighborhoods

quiz_questions.q: What hypocrisy does @marsresident identify in 'violence can never be justified'?
quiz_questions.a: Same people justify Police killings and celebrate Bin Laden's death
quiz_questions.explanation: Antifa never murdered anyone - Police kill people daily, called justified

quiz_questions.q: What happened to Huey Newton's case?
quiz_questions.a: California Supreme Court dropped charges - trial unfair, wasn't allowed to testify about being shot first
